newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Van Miert urges balanced view on public services.
newsitem.headline: Van Miert urges balanced view on public services.

text.p: The European Union needs to develop a balanced approach to public services but there is no need to change EU treaty provisions on free competition, Commissioner Karel Van Miert told MEPs on September 4.
Van Miert, who is responsible for EU competition policy, was speaking during a European Parliament debate on public services.

MEPs are due to vote on Thursday on a motion from the Liberal group which says that while all citizens should continue to enjoy certain universal services, governments can no longer expect them to be run exclusively by public monopolies protected from competition.

Van Miert said the crucial issue was not whether a company providing a universal service was publicly or privately owned but whether it met certain essential requirements for quality and security of supply, reasonable prices, equal treatment of customers and transparent management.

The Commissioner said he did not think Article 90 of the EC treaty needed to be changed. That article applies EU rules on free competition to companies providing "services of general economic interest" as long as that does not hinder them from performing the tasks assigned to them.

A debate over how to guarantee "universal service" -- access by all citizens to affordable public services -- has been a central one in the EU's effort to end state monopolies in sectors such as telecommunications and postal services.
